meanings.definition: The act of leaping or jumping.
meanings.sent1: The springeing of the frog amazed the children at the pond.
meanings.sent2: The cat's springeing over the fence showed its agility.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo's springeing looked like a dance in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her springeing from rock to rock was like a graceful ballet.
meanings.sent5: The springeing of the deer through the forest was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The action of moving quickly or suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden springeing of the squirrel startled me.
meanings.sent2: I was surprised by the springeing of the ball across the field.
meanings.sent3: The springeing of the door made me jump back in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His springeing into action saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The springeing of the wind through the trees sounded like whispers.

meanings.sent1: The springeing of the rabbit caught my eye in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The sudden springeing of the fish in the pond startled me.
meanings.sent3: The springeing of the toy car across the room made the child giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her springeing towards the finish line was a burst of energy.
meanings.sent5: The springeing of the butterfly from flower to flower was mesmerizing.
